title: Open Console Gaming
description: Come play some consoles! Try new games, play with friends or catch up on a game you haven't finished yet.

title: Learn Splendor
description: Fast to play, deceptively simple to learn and a beautiful game, Splendor will have you mining the most wonderful gems - rubies, emeralds, sapphires, diamonds and others in the hopes of buying your own mines and shops, and even attracting a visit by a noble! If you find you enjoy it or like the sound of it, step up to the tournament.

title: Drawing Composite monsters: A collaboration
description:
Free form audience participation thing - I'll either select people to come and draw the bits, or if no one wants to come up, I'll get the audience to select the species of beast that the bits come from.

Leece: Alright, what species of eagle do you want the gryphon's wings to come from? 

Audience member: Wedgetail!

If all goes well, it could be a combination of both, we will just have to see how we go on the evening

title: Meet the Swancon A/V guy
description: Attention Swancon panelist, this session has been allotted for you to come and check out the standard A/V setup of your panel room. Should you require to test your devices, now is the time! Your friendly A/V Guy, Andy Hahn, will be available to chat to if you have any questions or requests.

title: Christopher vs Collins: Dystopias Past and Present
people: Sue Ackerman, Tsana Dolichva, Leonie Rogers, Cat Sparks
description:
MODERATOR: SUE ACKERMAN
Young adult dystopias panel (ie, Hunger games, Divergent, others etc).YA dystopias have a lot more history than people imagine, and the idea of a bunch of teens scrapping out some form of survival has been seen in John Christopher novels through to Susan Collins. What draws us back into this theme again and again? How has technology changed the way the dystopias are formed, or how our young adults respond to the various apocalypses.

title: Gods and Monsters: Doctor Who's 13th Season
people: Aaron Creaser, Damian Magee, Heather Magee, Danny Oz, Colin Sharpe, Grant Watson
description: In 1975 Doctor Who returned to the BBC for its 13th series. It saw Tom Baker firmly establish himself as the most popular Doctor the series had ever had, and secure his Doctor's partnership with Sarah-Jane Smith (Elizabeth Sladen) in the minds of viewers forever. Over the course of six serials, viewers saw the Doctor and Sarah fight the Loch Ness Monster, travel to the edge of the universe, battle an Egyptian God, encounter robot duplicates, challenge an enemy from Time Lord history and struggle the save the Earth from an enormous plant. Join us as we celebrate one of Doctor Who's most popular and memorable seasons of all time.

title: Hyrule Warriors
description: Play as characters from the Legend of Zelda games. Fight against endless hordes of foes and special bosses to reclaim Hyrule from an evil dark power. This game is variant on the Dynasty warriors games

title: Traders and Art Show
venues: South Ballroom (Traders and Art Show Room)

title: Halfling Heist
description: "Halfling Heist is a fast-paced board game that pits you against three other rival Halfling thieves. Snatch as much food as possible and scram before the City Watch catches you red-handed with someone else’s chicken sandwich. It’s quick, fun and brutal as you dodge the barroom brawl and try to outgrab and outscore your fellow Halflings. The more hits you take, the more Luck you’ll gain - just make sure you get out in time to enjoy your meal!

title: Great Pteranodon Project
description: Alice-Ptichka the Terror of the Skies: How a revenant devil of the Cretaceous took over my life and made me slave for a year over hot steel.

title: FF - How To Be More Skeptical 101
GoH - Speech - Kylie Chan
description:
Kylie's Guest of Honour Speech
North and centre ballroom as one

title: Creche Rhymes
description:
Your favourite nursery rhymes, with a twist. Come and sing some of the geekiest versions of kids songs ever, and maybe even write some yourself!

Lyrics for the current batch of Creche Rhymes can be found here:

title: Food as Worldbuilding
people: Bec Handcock, Donna Maree Hanson, Shona Husk, Devin Jeyathurai, Glenda Larke, Dave Luckett
description:
MODERATOR: BEC HANDCOCK
A look into how food is used in world building to develop a sense of atmosphere in creative works. Everybody eats – but how does what they eat tell you about how they live? What traditions, customs, and flavours dominate the local food? In what ways can the protagonist highlight or learn things about themselves from their experiences? Food has been used in books such as the Kushiels’ Dart series, A Song of Fire and Ice, and the Legend of the Seeker. How did the authors use food in their books?

Soylent green is people.

title: The Big Finish: Full cast radio plays make a comeback.
description:
Come and find what makes a Big Finish Audio and what they are all about.

Subscribers get more at Big Finish.

title: Juggling: A How-To Guide
description: Juggling is a great way to exercise your hand-eye coordination and improve your reaction times. And it's fun! Come and learn to juggle with someone who taught herself with YouTube videos. All ages welcome! Suitable for anyone who can throw and catch :)

title: Launch - Deborah Kalin - Cherry Crow Children
description:
We launched the first 2 volumes of the Twelve Planets - Nightsiders and Love and Romanpunk at Swancon 36. At Swancon 40 in April, we will release the twelfth volume in this collection – Cherry Crow Children by Deborah Kalin.
4 years in the making, 12 volumes of (mostly) 4 short stories, each by some of Australia’s finest short story writers, many now award winning.

Expect cake. Expect sheer joy at delivering this awesome ride of a project. Expect New Projects.

title: Learn Ogre
description: This classic Steve Jackson two player game of ginormous cyber tank against an army. This is one of the most portable, affordable, cardboard wargames out there and it has held up well to the test of time.

title: Launch - Tehani Wessely - "Insert Title Here"
description: Launch of book "Insert Title Here"

title: Beauty & the Beast: The Original Werewolf Tale?
description: Could this be the origin of the werewolf tale? Taking a look at the classic, we asks the question, is this the original werewolf story? And if not, where does it come from? Come and join in, who knows where the journey will take us.

title: Mario Kart WiiU
description: Play as iconic Nintendo characters racing to win trohpies and gain fame. Race across a variety of courses from various Nintendo franchises. This will be run as a tournament.

title: How to be a good GM (Pt 1 of 2)
people: Daniel Drhoz, Tash Maitland, Daniel Ryba, Adrian Smith, Frames White
description:
MODERATOR: FRAMES WHITE 
Are you a GM? (Games Master/Dungeon Master/Storyteller etc) Do you get frustrated by your players? Or are there players you would pay to have in your group? Join us for this panel on what makes a good Games Master and share your tricks and tips.

title: Costuming for Fun and Effect!
description: "What to wear? Costuming can be fun, daring, frightening, cheap or expensive. The difference between fantastic and forgettable can often lie in the first stages of planning. We hope to take you through some of the steps of choosing a costume, and tips for execution. Or; How to make a costume for fun and effect"

title: Looking Beyond the Left Hand: Gender and Sexuality in Contemporary SF
people: Tsana Dolichva, Alisa Krasnostein, Gene Melzack, Alex Pierce
description: It has been more than 45 years since Ursula Le Guin’s novel The Left Hand of Darkness stunned readers with its thoughtful and ground-breaking portrayal of shifting gender and sexuality. Almost five decades later, it remains one of the commonly cited examples of science fiction that pushes the boundary of gender identity and sexuality. How far have we come since then? How are contemporary writers exploring these concepts and ideas, and to what extent – if any – has the real world followed or even overtaken them? What responsibility do authors have to reflect or provoke gender issues in their fiction?

title: Learn Take 6!
description: This card game will have you narrowly surveying your cards for the one that fits best. Fast, fun and sometimes frustrating, try to ensure that your opponents get to take cards, while you avoid taking cards yourself. If you're forced to, try to set up others to take a fall.

title: The Basics of Drawing
description: Learn how to draw basic shapes, animals, dragons or maybe even people with Nancy!

title: Anime (and Manga) for ABSOLUTE Beginners
people: Michael Cogan, Andy Hahn, Heather Magee, Candice Schilder
description: So you have seen some dubbed TV that someone described as "Anime" and you are curious. You want to watch more (And also read some of the strange "Manga" they are based on) but there's so much stuff out there and you don't know where to start. Our friendly panelists are here to help!

title: The Person behind the TimeLords: The Script editors of Doctor Who
people: Damian Magee, Danny Oz, Grant Watson
description: A good script editor can winnow out the chaff and polish the rough gems into shining masterpieces. We look at the craft and at some of the best.

title: Terrors of the Second Draft
people: Amanda Bridgeman, Russell B Farr, Donna Maree Hanson, Keith Stevenson
description:
MODERATOR: RUSSELL B FARR
A lot of aspiring novelists focus so intently on getting their first draft compete that they never pause to consider what comes next: the rewrite. For some it’s a brilliant opportunity, for others an unwanted task filled with reluctance and dread. What is the best way to go about rewriting your fiction once you’ve completed it? What are the best tricks, techniques and tips to take your work from good to brilliant? What are the traps and pitfalls to avoid? A panel of professional writers discuss their own creative process in refining their works for publication.

title: The Writer's Interview: Kylie Chan
description: Interview with our guests from a whole career retrospective: where they came from, what influenced them, what led them to the career they have today.

title: Learn Ugg-Tect
description: As palaeolithic builders you rely on teamwork, gestures and strange sounding words to get Stonehenge built the way it should be. Your Ugg-Tect knows what it should look like, but no one else does.  If you find you enjoy the game, step up for the panel game version of Ugg-Tect Royale (see program) as one of the contestan

title: Super Smash Bros WiiU/3DS
description: Play as various Nintendo characters from all sorts of Nintendo games. Watch them beat each other up in a frantic fighting game for up to 8 players at the same time! This will be run as a tournament.

title: Enlightenment vs Resistance: Ingress, a globetrotting real world MMO.
people: Doug Burbidge, Danny Oz, Sarah Parker, Erin Stark
description: Come and find out about Ingress, a rapidly growing "Real World" MMO based on digital interactions with real world objects. Find out about the two factions, the methods of the game and why so many people in Perth have joined.

title: The End of the Printed Page: Are Books (as we know them) Dead?
people: PRK , Amanda Bridgeman, Kylie Chan, Donna Maree Hanson, Louisa Loder
description:
MODERATOR: PRK
Is reading books dead? In the age of TV, movies, youtube and fanfiction, are the publishing industry and high quality fiction dead?

title: How to be a good RPGer (Pt 2 of 2)
people: Daniel Drhoz, Tash Maitland, Daniel Ryba, Adrian Smith, Frames White
description:
MODERATOR: FRAMES WHITE 
Are you a RPGer? Do you get frustrated by your GMs? Or is there a GM that you would pay to have run your group? Join us for this panel on what makes a good RPGer and share your tricks and tips.

title: Reframed and Repackaged: SF as literature
people: Jack Bridges, Tsana Dolichva, Bec Handcock, Cat Sparks
description:
MODERATOR: BEC HANDCOCK
Some of the best speculative fiction available can’t be found in the science fiction or fantasy sections of the bookshop - you need to go hunting in the “literature” shelves for Attwood, Palahniuk and Murakami, among others. A discussion on why authors and publishers choose or are encouraged to be marketed within or without the genre they are writing in, and in some cases to refuse to acknowledge genre at all. What makes a book science fiction, and what makes it literature?

title: Learn Ticket to Ride: Europe
description: This is a fast, incredibly popular and fun boardgame for the whole family. Easy to learn! Connect your cities and risk short cuts through tunnels to obtain your goals. Will your opponents block you? Play with your little carriage pieces in the meantime, and remember, every line you don't complete is subtracted from your score at the end!

description: Room is open with books, toys, and random crafts or colouring in. Feel free to come in for a quiet moment, take a deep breath or have a glass of water.

Geekling Sing-A-Long

Astroboy!

description:
MODERATOR: FRAMES WHITE
God’s Advocate - devil’s advocate panel in which I will defend fundamental christianity and the bible from the audience who will attempt to dissuade me (Jonathan)

title: Kickstart, Patreon, Online Methods of Fundraising for Personal Projects
people: Helen Highwater, Travis Johnson, Matt Lindus
description:
MODERATOR: RUSSELL B FARR
Kickstarter, Patreon, there's more and more ways of creating income or sourcing funds for projects than ever before. We take a look at some of them by people who have done it successfully, and unsuccessfully, and look into how they work, what they can and can't do, and stories about the experience.

people: Zara Baxter, Louisa Loder, Cat Sparks, Keith Stevenson
description: “There is no place like home” Scifi takes us away from home. How has our world changed as a result of SF?

description: Interview with our guests from a whole career retrospective: where they came from, what influenced them, what led them to the career they have today.

title: Who Owns "Culture", anyway? Working outside your own.
people: PRK , Kylie Chan, Christopher Hwang, Devin Jeyathurai, Ian Nichols
description: "Many stories are told from outside our own cultural “boundaries”, either as a direct transplant or a cultural “homage”. What should we be aware of when we do this? What problems can happen? How do we make sure we aren't being offensive or inappropriate?"

title: Intersections Between Sex and Technology
description: Sex is often assumed to be natural and instinctive but it has always been intricately connected with technology. This presentation will discuss some of these intersections and speculate about where technology might lead us in the future.

Halo 4
description: Come enlist as a Spartan in the UNSC! Compete against other Spartans for glory and points to be the beat...and once you've survived that, we'll throw you into a bunch of crazy alternative games such as Demolition Derby, Run to survive, Super Happy Fun Land and Left 4 Dead! This will be run as a tournament.

description: Agent Carter - by Desiree

If you find you enjoy it or like the sound of it, step up to the tournament.

title: Let's build a Civilisation: One Continent
tags: Art / Artistic, Guest of Honour Item, Mod
people: Sally Beasley, Shona Husk, Lisa Rye, John Scalzi, Candice Schilder
description:
MODERATOR: SALLY BEASLEY
On an otherwise boring Blue-Green world, orbiting a rather normal G type main sequence star lies the continent of Swanconia. Let's build the people, lands, countries and economy of this remarkable world.
Like worldbuilding, but less likely to degenerate to "Bat creatures living in blobs of water in a universe ENTIRELY MADE OF ICE!!!one!"

title: Scared S#!%less: How Horror Movies Work
description:
Scared S#!%less: How Horror Movies Work
Many enjoy a good horror movie, but few consider how they actually work. Why are we drawn to things that frighten or startle us? Learn the techniques used by horror directors from America, Europe and Asia to see why precisely horror cinema frightens us - and why we enjoy it.

title: Under Construction - Marketing
description: With steadily rising costs for function space, accommodation and airfare, conventions need to either attract and retain new members, steadily raise membership prices, or reduce the size / length of the convention. This session examines how conventions can best market to potential new members with limited budgets?

title: I Got My Sex Education from Fiction Books
description:
A question and answer discussion panel with lots of audience participation.

In our youth as geeks, we all likely read above our average reading level, and in our journey through the library inevitably encountered that one fantasy book with the.... uh... intimate scene. Discuss with us: is this a good thing or a bad thing? Should children be able to read whatever they want? How do fiction books portray sexuality? And how should they

title: Beefcake!!! The Third
description:
Beefcake III: The Beefening!

Come along for the updated, revamped, and actually organised for once Beefcake. No, really. We're organised.

title: The Batman Problem: The Dark Nut Returns
people: Devin Jeyathurai, Travis Johnson, John Parker
description: All things considered, Batman is probably the most popular superhero of all time. He recently celebrated his 75th birthday, he stars in numerous comic books each month, and for decades he’s been adapted for animation, television, videogames and film. The problem is: should we like him at all? He’s presented as a masked crime fighter saving the lives of countless Gothamites, but when you think about it he’s also a mentally unhinged billionaire who dresses in fetish outfits every night and assaults the mentally unwell. Come take a look at Batman and his fictional universe from a fresher perspective: you may not like what you see.

title: GWEN Live stream (Up From Down Under with Michael)
Open Console Gaming

If you find you enjoy it or like the sound of it, step up to the tournament.

description: This powerpoint presentation look at beginning of TV Animation has been a staple diet, some has become classics, awhile others have been forgotten; like Crusader Rabbit, Funny Company, King Leonard & his Short Subjects, Here Comes Grump and many others.

title: Under Construction - Convention Theme
description: A convention is a fantastic way to steer an overall conversation about the genre. What do you want your convention to *say*? What is its theme? How can you want to use your convention, guests and programme to question or redirect how we interact with speculative fiction?

title: Live Action Robo Rally
venues: South Ballroom (Traders and Art Show Room)
description: Life Sized Robo Rally! Come along and either program your friends into terrible situations or alternatively, be the robotic plaything of a deranged computer, as represented by your friends.

title: What's happening with the Square Kilometre Array, and the Murchison Widefield Array
description:
Dr Andrew Williams, Curtin University

The Square Kilometre Array will be the biggest telescope ever built, tens or hundreds of times more sensitive than any other radio telescope. It's going to be built on two sites, one in South Africa and the other here in WA. The only problem was that the original design was costed at three times as much money as was available to build it...

The complex 're-baselining' negotiations have just finished, and the SKA office have released the new SKA layout and adjusted timeline. I'll talk about what that will mean to the project as a whole as well as us here in WA. I'll also talk about the telescope I work on, the Murchison Widefield Array, a direct precursor to the low-frequency part of the SKA.

title: XXP Girls Rage Quit Triggers
people: Alix Chinnery, Megan Coles, Hope Corrigan, Danica Zuks
description:
A 45 minute therapy session for every game where you've flipped the table, pulled out the Cat5, screamed into voice chat or stomped on the little game pieces. 

Here are the founding members of XXP & the previous president of the Southern Cross DOTA as they regale you with their every rage quit

title: Natcon Business Meeting
description: Natcon Business Meeting

title: History of Roguelikes - from Rogue to Crawl
people: Evan Beasley, Devin Jeyathurai, John Parker, Lisa Rye, Adrian Smith
description:
MODERATOR: DEVIN JEYATHURAI
The genre that continues. From it's earliest roots on mainframes with DND and Rogue, through it's continued evolution and the impact on the greater gaming mindset, with concepts like randomly generated dungeons (Diablo, Torchlight), Permadeath (Don't Starve) and weird artifacts that need to be explored to be understood (Borderlands)

title: This game is so good, I'm prepared to speak for 3 minutes in public on it. (2)
people: Andrea Hatch, Brian Johnson, Leece Smith
description: Are you passionate about a game? You have 3 minutes to give a lightning presentation to persuade the audience that the game is worth trying! Watch as 9 other people speak passionately about games they think are worth it.

title: Anthony and Grant The Non-Writerly Interview
description: Anthony and Grant Stone are the cornerstones of Swancon. From humble beginnings in Anthony's house with a handful of people and a clutch of hatching ducklings to hundreds of people in a very shiny hotel, Swancon has grown organically over the last 40 years. Come along and ask questions in this informal discussion with two of Perth's fandom veterans.

description: This card game will have you narrowly surveying your cards for the one that fits best. Fast, fun and sometimes frustrating, try to ensure that your opponents get to take cards, while you avoid taking cards yourself. If you're forced to, try to set up others to take a fall.

MODERATOR: DAVINA WATSON
Interesting stories from when Swancon was younger.

title: Please Hammer, Don't Hurt 'em: The lesser known Hammer Horror movies.
description: This powerpoint presentation take look at other Hammer has made over the years, from Thrillers, Sci-Fi, Comedies, war, drama and of course Horror. From films as She, Phantom of the Opera, The Nanny, The Lost Continent and many others.

title: Adventure Time Colouring In
description: Adventure Time Colouring In! Any one welcome!

title: Climate Change - is it Affecting our Spec Fic?
tags: Guest of Honour Item, Science and Tech, Writing
people: Glenda Larke, John Scalzi, Cat Sparks, Keith Stevenson
description: There’s a strand of SF that likes to consider our ultimate demise. In the middle of the last century that was likely to be through nuclear conflagration. Nowadays it’s climate change disaster. But portraying the antagonist as an elemental force rather than a ‘bunch of nuke-crazy Reds’ brings its own challenges from a writing perspective. How have writers tackled these very real fears over the past decade or so, and is there still room for a happy ending?

description: This is a fast, incredibly popular and fun boardgame for the whole family. Easy to learn! Connect your cities and risk short cuts through tunnels to obtain your goals. Will your opponents block you? Play with your little carriage pieces in the meantime, and remember, every line you don't complete is subtracted from your score at the end!

description: Now we know who the rather awesome Guests of Honour will be for 2016, come along and find out what works the 2016 committee recommend we consume so we are ready for next year.

tags: Fantasy, Guest of Honour Item, Sci-Fi
people: Kylie Chan, Chris Coman, Jonathan Durnford, Kimberley Larking
description: workshop: get people to come up with the most practical, savvy Evil Overlord possible (competition maybe?) - Kim

title: Sci Fi and Horror TV Anthologies
description: Anthologies has brought us on screen some of the classic sci-fi & Horror stories, as this powerpoint presentation take on a journey to Outer Limits, Twilight Zone, The Night Gallery, Out of the Unknown with a Touch of Evil.

title: Nerf Games 2015
venues: South Ballroom (Traders and Art Show Room)
description:
Rebel Empire Workshop NERF Games 2015
Come and join in some NERF Gun fun with the REW Imperium! A room will be transformed into a rubber foam NERF range with one purpose, shoot the targets the fastest with an array of NERF guns! Whether you are new to NERF guns or not, it will be guaranteed to be full of laughter and excitement.
There will be a gold coin donation before entry to this event. For those willing to participate, there will be  NERF prizes and to be won for each game!

title: Podcasting Your Passion
description: Podcasting Your Passion: Getting into Geeking Out Over The Airwaves (ft. Daniel Midgely) Podcasting - from Serial to Nerdist, from Pharos Project to Smodcast, there's a number of online radio shows that demonstrate that there's an audience for anything. But how might you get started? Tips and tricks by local podcasters and radio broadcasters on different formats for the curious and quizzical.

title: FF - Why Once Upon A Time is Better than Fanfiction
Dark Dungeons: Who is Jack Chick?
people: Dave Cake, Devin Jeyathurai, Candice Schilder, Grant Stone
description:
MODERATOR: CANDICE SCHILDER
Dark Dungeons is an unironic exploration of roleplaying as evil, as seen through the eyes of Jack Chick. jack Chick is famous for creating a series of badly drawn comics depicting DnD as dangerous and evil, and these comics being printed and distributed by hand to mailboxes around Australia (and America?) Come and find out more about the Chick Tracts and see the trailer/opening scenes from the movie "Dark Dungeons"

title: Apocalypse During Swancon - Group Workshop
tags: Discussion, Fantasy, Sci-Fi, X For Beginners
people: Chris Coman, Danny Oz, Sarah Xu
description: The apocalypse happens while we’re at the hotel. We have 350ish attendees of varying ages and skills. How do we survie? How do we run things? greater good or best death? Food, plans, location? (Will need to be fleshed out as the nature of the apocalypse will affect the plans)

title: Australian Game Design and History
people: Steve Gunnell, Roland Kerr, Rob Masters, Leece Smith, Anthony Sweet
description: A look at the past, present and future of the history of board games in Australia. You will be surprised at the breadth, depth and scope, not to mention ingenuity of Australian designers past and present.

title: Ant Who Now? Characters who deserve a movie before Antman
description:
Antman gets a movie and we all say WTF?
Who should be on the big screen first and why.

There are SOOOOOOOO MANY characters who deserve a film more than Ant-Man. Two of those characters have now had a film announced. 

In this very short presentation, learn who those characters are and why they need a film. This panel is strictly Marvel.

Who doesn't love a lazy Saturday morning with some good, old fashioned cartoons? A relaxing time to have some TV fun. 

Shows include:

title: Just Imagine: Costumes in Early SF Films
description:
Just imagine: costume in early SF film.
This presentation will examine how film pioneers contructed versions of possible futures through costume. It will examine some of the political, social and cultural ramifications of these constructions. It will explore how film costume converses with current fashion trends  and will also look briefly at the relationship between film costume and contemporary SF illustration. This is a preliminary survey of what I hope will become a longer work. The main films explored will include:  Le voyage dans la Lune (1902),  Aelita (1924), Metropolis (1927), Just imagine (1930) and Things to Come (1936).

title: GoH - Speech - John Scalzi
description: John Scalzi rants, raves, and goes ballistic over whatever the hell he likes.

title: The Hollow Reaches Playtest (1)
people: Roland Kerr, Jon Van Buren, Frames White
description: RetCon games, Perth's newest gaming start-up, would like to invite you to help playtest a fresh new game: The Hollow Reaches. It is a fast-paced, procedurally generated, Rogue-like, RPG card-game. Join us to playings as the mysterious agents of an even more mysterious entity. Expect armies of foes to fall in your wake. Expect challenging problems and moral dilemmas. Expect a system with unique mechanics, that has never seen public play before.

title: Magical and SF Detective Fiction: Police Procedurals and similar in non mainstream settings.
people: Sally Beasley, Stephen Dedman, Alex Isle, Leece Smith
description:
MODERATOR: SALLY BEASLEY
Whether it's Master Li and Number 10 Ox, Tom Dreyfus, Harry Dresden, Detective Chen or Eve Dallas the panelists will discuss their favourites and what makes this mix of genres so entertaining.

title: Colouring In - My Little Pony
description: Colouring and discussion about our favourite ponies!

title: Robert Hood - Reading -  'Peripheral Visions'
description: Peripheral Visions

title: The Fiction Factory: Speculative Fiction and Professional Publishing
people: Alisa Krasnostein, Robin Pen, Tehani Wessely, Tehani Wessely
description: In the world of professional publishing, who ultimately decides which novels get published, and which do not? What are the factors at play in determining what kinds of books come out, when they come out, how long or short they are, and what formats they are published in? Why your favourite author’s novel has come out late, early, or in A-format paperback, or why it hasn’t come out at all? Why do good books slip through the cracks? Why do bad books turn up on every bookstore shelf? We present an insight into the publishing industry, with all of the answers you wanted to know – and a few about which you would probably rather remain ignorant.

title: Reading - Ian Nichols - Title Goes Here
In Memory of Terry Pratchett
description:
VENUE: HOTEL BAR TO RIGHT OF FOYER 
Terry Pratchett was one of Swancon's favourite guests, and he touched many people in Perth with his warmth, wit and intelligence. Many people here have stories to share, so please come to the bar for a quiet drink, share and listen, and think of a great man who has passed.

title: Launch 2016
description: Launch

title: Dave Luckett - Children's Reading
description: Family reading for children by Dave Luckett

title: DS Fun-o-rama
description: Bring your DS, 3DS or 2DS for some group gaming fun with other hand held console gaming players. We'll be playing Mario kart DS or 7, Pokemon, etc. Chargers will be available if you're low on battery!

title: Learn Ticket to Ride: Europe
description: This is a fast, incredibly popular and fun boardgame for the whole family. Easy to learn! Connect your cities and risk short cuts through tunnels to obtain your goals. Will your opponents block you? Play with your little carriage pieces in the meantime, and remember, every line you don't complete is subtracted from your score at the end!

title: FF - Orphan Black
description: Orphan Black by Alisa and Alex

title: Launch - Louisa Loder - "Stormfate"
description:
Take a glimpse into the monster-ravaged land of Padallia at the launch of Stormfate, the bite-sized fantasy novella by local novelist Louisa Loder.
==========================
Under the endless spread of trees in the infamous Fallow Wood, the remaining forces of the Royal Guard feel the tension of the gathering storm and begin to question their leadership . Even with his best friend Valnor by his side, King Hadrian is on edge and feels helpless to protect the land of Padallia. High above the city of Dunarran, Queen Ardea maintains a worried vigil over the dark stain of the Wood from her tower window and watches for her husband's return. Wylden, a Fae Ranger, is also caught in the storm as he searches for the answers that his Elders are unwilling to give him.

The storm breaks with an unparalleled ferocity, and rages through the night. No one escapes unscathed, and Padallia will be changed forever.

title: UggTect Royale - The Second Clubbing
people: Rob Masters, Rob Masters, Leece Smith
description:
as seen in 2014

Ugg-Tect Royale: The Second Clubbing.
 Ugg-Tect Royal will be showing at Swancon 40. This modification of the hilarious Ugg-Tect party game pits 4 highly skilled (mystified looks a specialty) along with their long suffering Ugg-Tects against each other in a race to complete megalithic monuments. While the audience and the Ugg-Tects know what the structure is meant to look like, the builders have no idea, and instructions are in strict caveman talk and gesture.
Leece & Rob are for looking for up to 16 participants with good communications skills and the ability to work in a small, tightly integrated team. They must be willing to provide endless looks of confusion, bafflement and frustration.

title: King Lizard: 60 years of Godzilla
people: Robert Hood, Damian Magee, Robin Pen
description: This panels takes look at history of King of the Monsters, including adaptions, competitors and variants. With the high profile releases in recent years of Godzilla and Pacific Rim, it seems like the giant monster (or “kaiju”) is back in fashion around the world. What is it about the giant monster that appeals to us so much? What can these movies give audiences that they can’t get from other speculative fiction films?

title: What Makes a Good Short Story
people: Stephanie Gunn, Louisa Loder, Juliet Marillier, Anthony Panegyres
description: Everything and anything you want to know about the genre short story - questions from the audience welcomed!

title: Launch - Leonie Rogers - "Frontier Resistance"
description: Come and celebrate the launch of Book Two of the Frontier series from Leonie Rogers and Hague Publishing! Promising more excitement, explosions and starcats, Rogers brings the next installment in Shanna's story.

title: Learn Splendor
description: Fast to play, deceptively simple to learn and a beautiful game, Splendor will have you mining the most wonderful gems - rubies, emeralds, sapphires, diamonds and others in the hopes of buying your own mines and shops, and even attracting a visit by a noble! If you find you enjoy it or like the sound of it, step up to the tournament.

title: Pathfinder - We Be Goblins
description:
Game: Pathfinder - We Be Goblins,
System: Paizo Pathfinder,
Genre: Fantasy,
Game Masters: Tash Maitland / Daniel Ryba,
Length: 3 hours,
Participants: 4-5 (excluding game masters),
 
The Licktoad goblins of Brinestump Marsh have stumbled upon a great treasure—fireworks! Yet unfortunately for them, the tribe member responsible for the discovery has already been exiled for the abhorrent crime of writing (which every goblin knows steals words from your head). To remedy this situation, the Licktoads’ leader, His Mighty Girthness Chief Rendwattle Gutwad, has declared that the greatest heroes of the tribe must venture forth to retrieve the rest of the fireworks from a derelict ship stranded in the marsh. In order to prove themselves as the Licktoads’ bravest goblins, the PCs must complete a series of dangerous dares, from swallowing bull slugs and braving the dreaded Earbiter to dancing with Squealy Nord himself. Yet even once they’ve proven their mettle, the adventure is just beginning. For the ship in question is far from uninhabited, and Vorka the cannibal goblin would like nothing better than a few tasty visitors....

title: Soul Caliber 4 & 5
description: People beating each other up with swords, guns...a giant hammer...that squeeks...yep! Soul Calibur in a nutshell and we'll be playing the 4th and 5th generation of the game. This will be run as a tournament.

title: Open Room - No Scheduled Event
description: Room is open with books, toys, and random crafts or colouring in. Feel free to come in for a quiet moment, take a deep breath or have a glass of water.

title: The Sword Drawn! Kitty and John Explore Excalibur
description:
In our third (of what has mutated into a strange tradition) panel exploring Chris Claremont derived titles, we explore the critically acclaimed XMen spinoff, Excalibur, from it's roots in Captain Britain (With writing by Alan Moore!) through the good years, the bad years and everything inbetween. 
This year we have prepared!(This will only cover the English superhero team, not the later American teams with a similar name)

title: House of Cards: Disney Animation from 1995 to 2004
description: By 1994 Walt Disney Animation Studios had broken box office records around the world with The Lion King and was coasting high on the success of a string of massive hits. Just 10 years later and the studio was all but closed, with traditional animation falling in the path of CGI and Disney’s once-firmed monopoly shattered by a range of competitors. This presentation tracks the development of Walt Disney animation over that decade and explores how studio interference, accelerated production schedules and some of the strangest creative choices ever made brought a once-great studio to its knees.

title: Costume Crafting for Kids
description: With the kids' masquerade next in line, it's time to make your own costume! Kids can make their costumes out of whatever they can find in the recycle box. Elsa, Wall-E, a dinosaur, the only limit is your imagination!

title: Crits and Grits - When Are Crit Groups A Good Idea?
people: Anthony Panegyres, Carol Ryles, Keith Stevenson, Helen Stubbs
description: Crit groups and writing groups are an important part of the business of writing. When do you need to find one? When you do, how do you handle hearing things you don't want to hear? Will you ever be friends again? Do you ever NOT need a critgroup?

title: From Asimov to Zelazny: upholding the classics
people: Sally Beasley, Stephen Dedman, Gina Goddard, Anna Hepworth, Leonie Rogers
description: New science fiction novels are published every year. With a constantly growing pool of works from which to choose, how should successive generations of SF readers approach the classic novels of the 21st century? As time passes, more and more writers run the risk of becoming overlooked, relegated to memory, or even abandoned altogether. Who are the authors whose works continue to stand up today? Who are the forgotten authors whose works require rediscovery? Who – if any – remain popular today, but whose writing is probably best put aside for good?

title: Learn Ugg-Tect
description:
Learn Ugg-Tect
As palaeolithic builders you rely on teamwork, gestures and strange sounding words to get Stonehenge built the way it should be. Your Ugg-Tect knows what it should look like, but no one else does.  If you find you enjoy the game, step up for the panel game version of Ugg-Tect Royale (see program) as one of the contestan

title: Return of the Editors Strike Back
people: Kylie Chan, Stephen Dedman, Andrew Harvey, Cat Sparks
description:
MODERATOR: STEPHEN DEDMAN
A panel of editors (or former editors) of sf magazines and publishers do a blind reading of first pages of anonymous submissions from writers (who will, ideally, be in the audience), and vote/comment on whether they'd be inclined to continue reading. Work would be read aloud, but authors not identified unless they spoke up.

title: New Who: The Capaldi Continuum
people: Michael Cogan, Aaron Creaser, Damian Magee, Heather Magee
description: This panel takes a look at Peter Capaldi's first season of the Doctor: the stories that worked and those that did not. How did people feel when the late Brigadier turn into a Cyberman? What of The Master, now The Mistress? Come join us and express your views.

title: Kids Masquerade
description: The kids have spent all day preparing for their big event - the children's masquerade! Come along to the Fan Foyer to see the Masquerade and cheer the children on!

title: Scott Pilgrim VS The World The Game Co-op Bananza!
description: Like Scott Pilgram vs the world? Now you can play as characters from the series and go through the story with 3 friends! The game is made as a 16 bit graphic game in the art style of the comics!

title: Learn Survive! Escape from Atlantis!
description: The island seemed so peaceful but you and your tribe soon realise it's getting smaller. That can't be good. As lowland areas succumb to the waves you heave sighs of relief as you all head for the boats pointed at the mainland. But it looks like everyone else has the same idea, and there aren't enough boats. Oh well, you can swim. Try to avoid the sharks but perhaps the dolphins will help. And you're sure that the rumours of Giant Octopus and Sea Serpents are completely unfounded. Anyone still in the water or on on Atlantis when the volcano erupts isn't going to be contributing genes to the mainland settlements.

title: SciFi Yet Skeptical
tags: Guest of Honour Item, Science and Tech
people: PRK , Daniel Midgely, John Scalzi, Kylie Sturgess
description:
MODERATOR: PRK
An 101 on skeptical thinking, from vaccine myths to cryptozoology, and why knowing more about the world is no hindrance to creative thinking and wonderment. If you're into Asimov, Sagan, Scalzi or Sigler, get to know more about the philosophy behind many of their creations. Featuring local skeptical and science fiction writers

title: Learn Take 6!
description: This card game will have you narrowly surveying your cards for the one that fits best. Fast, fun and sometimes frustrating, try to ensure that your opponents get to take cards, while you avoid taking cards yourself. If you're forced to, try to set up others to take a fall.

title: Learn Splendor
description: Fast to play, deceptively simple to learn and a beautiful game, Splendor will have you mining the most wonderful gems - rubies, emeralds, sapphires, diamonds and others in the hopes of buying your own mines and shops, and even attracting a visit by a noble! If you find you enjoy it or like the sound of it, step up to the tournament.

title: Left 4 Dead 1 and 2 - Survival Endurance Marathon
description: Play as a surviver of the zombie apocolypse with 3 friends trying to reach a safe haven. Your goal is to play through every stage and survive it all! We'll be nice to you...I promise...

title: Paranormal Romance : What hasn't been done?
people: Jack Bridges, Rebecca Laffar-Smith, Lana Pecherczyk
description:
Werewolves, Vampires sure. Zombies... Ohkay. Unicorns, um. How would that even work? Dragons? Gryphons? SANDWORMS???
Jack and Rebecca discuss paranormal romance that hasn't been done yet, and invite discussion from the audience.

title: Sing-Along with Sauron
description: Geek Sing A long for Adults

title: Open Console Gaming
description: Come play some consoles! Try new games, play with friends or catch up on a game you haven't finished yet.

title: Learn Splendor
description: Fast to play, deceptively simple to learn and a beautiful game, Splendor will have you mining the most wonderful gems - rubies, emeralds, sapphires, diamonds and others in the hopes of buying your own mines and shops, and even attracting a visit by a noble! If you find you enjoy it or like the sound of it, step up to the tournament.

title: Swapmeet setup
venues: South Ballroom (Traders and Art Show Room)

title: Meet the Swancon A/V guy
description: Attention Swancon panelist, this session has been allotted for you to come and check out the standard A/V setup of your panel room. Should you require to test your devices, now is the time! Your friendly A/V Guy, Andy Hahn, will be available to chat to if you have any questions or requests.

title: Old Games are New Again: The revival of classics in new ways
people: Ellora Ker, Rob Masters, Leece Smith
description: Monopoly, Battleships, Risk and the rest of the stable of "classic" games are getting new editions with new art, new rules and new tie ins. Does this help elevate them beyond their roots or is this the death rattle of the "old school" in the face of the newer "euro-games" style systems.

title: Blood, Bodices and Vincent Price: Looking ar the Horror works of Roger Corman
description: This powerpoint presentation takes look at Roger Corman during his fame of sixties, looking at some films he had made from Little Shop of Horrors to X: The Man with the X-ray eyes and his famous teaming sixties teaming with Vincent Price making Poe films classics.

title: General Crafting
description: We have boxes and boxes of crafting stuff. Come and play, all welcome!

title: Retro Gaming!
description: Miss the old days of console gaming? Well now you can come relive the era of the old classics because all the consoles will be changed over for Retro ones! Come play on the Super Nintendo, N64, Play station 1, Sega mega drive and other old school gaming platforms!

title: Swap Meet (And Artshow)
venues: South Ballroom (Traders and Art Show Room)

title: A Guide to Femslash Fandom
description: What makes fictional girls kissing so great, and where can you find it?

title: Ladies Comic Book Club
people: Violet Auld, Sigrid Edwards, Billie Harvey
description: "Based in Perth, Western Australia, the LCBC sponsored by Comiczone is a monthly meet-up exclusively for women focusing on a selected comic text to discuss in a book club format. The club caters to both to comic novices and experienced readers. The LCBC is all about creating a physical space free of judgement for women who are often targeted for being interested in a traditionally ‘male oriented’ activity. There is a risk that creating an exclusively female event would perpetuate the sort of negative, sex- and gender-based negativity we see manifest in things such as “Gamergate”. However, this event and its purposes do not have any root in strengthening the split between fans based on sex/gender. The events advocate a love of comics, not anything else. Although the LCBC is undeniably exclusive, it’s not anti-male. It is better described as pro-female."

title: The Hollow Reaches Playtest (2)
people: Roland Kerr, Jon Van Buren, Frames White
description: RetCon games, Perth's newest gaming start-up, would like to invite you to help playtest a fresh new game. It is a fast-paced, procedurally generated, Rogue-like, RPG card-game. Join us to playings as the mysterious agents of an even more mysterious entity. Expect armies of foes to fall in your wake. Expect challenging problems and moral dilemmas. Expect a system with unique mechanics, that has never seen public play before.

title: Kaffeeklatch - Kylie Chan (1)
tags: Discussion, Guest of Honour Item, Writing
description:
In the Foyer to the right (near the Bar) 
Pre-purchased memberships can purchase tickets to this in advance. $5 per ticket. Maximum of 10 attendees.

title: Introduction to Worldcon
people: PRK , Dave Cake, Christopher Hwang, Sarah Parker
description: What's a Worldcon? Why would you want to go or how can you be part of it without leaving your lounge room? This panel explores the various aspects of a World Science Fiction Convention, upcoming conventions and bids, and also covers volunteering. We can't guarantee there won't be any scurrilous stories though. G rated scurrilous stories of course.

title: Riding The Iron Bull: Why Is Dragon Age Inquisition So Damn Good?
people: Sophie Ambrose, Jetha Chan, Chris Coman, Adam McCaw
description:
MODERATOR: CHRIS COMAN
Riding The Iron Bull: Why Is Dragon Age Inquisition So Damn Good? Sophie and Jetha get into the nitty gritty of Dragon Age

title: Loving The Borg: Transhumanism in the Real World.
people: Zara Baxter, Doug Burbidge, Dave Cake, Robert Hood, Keith Stevenson
description:
MODERATOR: DOUG BURBIDGE
Humanity’s ultimate merging with the machine is a dream – or nightmare – depending on which Hollywood trope you subscribe to, but what would it really be like and how would it happen? With more and more smart wearables, where does transhumanism begin and end? Would a transhuman feel less human or more, and would they be the best judge of the change? Could they still love, hope, create if their conscious thoughts were reduced to a stream of ones and zeroes? Would they still feel tethered in the real world or lost in the infinite possibilities of virtual reality? Our panellists consider the many and varied ways that true transhumanism will change us forever.

title: Changing Communities with Intent
tags: Fandom, Guest of Honour Item, Transformative Works
people: PRK , Sandy Norman, Sarah Parker, John Scalzi
description:
MODERATOR:PRK
Discussion about the ways we have engaged with the communities around us to affect social change.

title: Kaffeeklatsch - Helen Stubbs
description:
In the Foyer to the right (near the Bar) 
Pre-purchased memberships can purchase tickets to this in advance. $5 per ticket. Maximum of 10 attendees.

title: Social Media, Marketing and Writing
people: Amanda Bridgeman, Kylie Chan, Devin Jeyathurai, Gillian O'meagher, Lana Pecherczyk
description:
MODERATOR: DEVIN JEYATHURAI
Social Media is a key advertising tool for the aspiring writer, or is it? Our panellists will look at Socmed as a platform to get your name out there, and maybe even talk about the way Narratives can fit within 120 characters, or a string of sentences can become a story, and all as a way to capture the attention of new readers.

title: More than just extra Umlats: Names and naming conventions in SF/F
people: Cathy Cupitt, Keith Stevenson, Tehani Wessely, Frames White
description:
MODERATOR: FRAMES WHITE
How do we come up with our naming and language themes? We have serious amounts of work going into creating good name / language structures. eg themed names, linguistic structures

title: (Over-used) Fan-Fiction Tropes
people: Belinda Forbes, Desiree Heald, Leonie Rogers, Candice Schilder
description:
MODERATOR: CANDICE SCHILDER
Fan-fiction likes to have a lot of tags when put out for public consumption. Within Fan-fiction, fans can play around with some of the tropes and ideas presented in their source material. What is it about Fan-fiction tropes that catch and hold us? Do we over use the tropes that we have? Do we need more, or less? May contain references to Grimm, Arrow, Flash and Teen Wolf.

title: Portal 2 Co-op
description: Play as two robots trying to survive the testing set by GLaDOS at Aperture science! Can you and a friend survive the tests?!

title: Rebel Empire Workshops Performance
venues: South Ballroom (Traders and Art Show Room)
description:
Rebel Empire Workshops - a Perth based stage and film production studio, invites Swancon attendees to experience their combination of live action and film performance.
From its origins as a fan based community, Rebel Empire Workshops has grown into a professional fight and stunt choreography company, specialising in live action and cinematic media. 
Drawing its members and inspiration from the general public, Rebel Empire offers the potential to teach anyone any and all aspects of stage and film production, from conceptual development and visual effects to fight choreography and stunt work, encouraging all its members to peruse their passions and to create something bigger than themselves.
Rebel Empire Workshops is on its 7th year and many things have grown in that time. From new Members to new Characters to Costumes, Props and of course Fight Choreography. So come and watch as the R.E.W. Cast and Crew put on a performance of fun and entertainment for all fans; young and old. Immediately following the performance there will be a chance to meet some of the cast and crew, including a brief Q&A session.

title: Tournament - Dixit
description:
How Well Do You Know People? Will your friend get that esoteric reference you were talking about just the other day? There will be a Dixit Tournament of an elimination round for up to 36 players followed by a final round for the winning six.

Dixit is a beautiful game with surreal, dreamlike cards. During the game the player selects a card, and indicates something about it or what it inspires to the other players without showing it to them. The other players choose cards from their hands that they think might also evoke this thing. The selected cards are all shuffled and laid out face up for players to vote on – which was the original card? Subtle, beautiful and described both as a party game for gamers and a gamer's game for party gamers Dixit is a game everyone should try at least once. Preferably with a whole bunch of strangers and one person you know very well.

title: Kaffeeklatsch - John Scalzi
tags: Discussion, Guest of Honour Item, Writing
description:
In the Foyer to the right (near the Bar) 
Pre-purchased memberships can purchase tickets to this in advance. $5 per ticket. Maximum of 10 attendees.

title: FF - Ancillary Justice by Annie Leckie
Jonathan's Stone Soup Stories
description: Jonathan guides every one to make up a story! Every one puts something into the soup story to make it great. Come along and join in!

title: FF - Collected works of Neil Gaiman and Amanda Palmer in 10 minutes
Spec Fic Writing - Science Potrayal in Fiction
people: PRK , Amanda Bridgeman, Tsana Dolichva, Donna Maree Hanson, Leonie Rogers, John Scalzi, Helen Stubbs
description:
MODERATOR: PRK
Speculative Fiction Writing Panel, looking at the way science is portrayed in writing. Science is often held as the bastion of hope, answering a need unfulfilled by religion, but faith is only a part of a good spec fic story. When using science, what are the good parts and the bad parts? How can we be better at it without memorizing physics books?

title: Lucy M Boston – An Appreciation
description: An appreciation of Lucy M Boston, the author of the Green Knowe fantasy series.

title: 2014 Movie Screenings: A Recap
description:
2014 Movie Screenings: A Recap
Lets discuss the movies that SwanCon screened last year and the movies that we chose not to. Will also include the trailers or snippets from the movies so we can all decide if the movie lived up to the expectation.

title: Kaffeeklatsch - Glenda Larke
description:
In the Foyer to the right (near the Bar) 
Pre-purchased memberships can purchase tickets to this in advance. $5 per ticket. Maximum of 10 attendees.

title: Big Dumb Objects: The Giant Artefacts of Science Fiction
people: Dave Cake, Gene Melzack, Alex Pierce, Frames White
description:
MODERATOR: Frames White
Science fiction regularly deals with the ‘big dumb object’, the strange alien monolith that is discovered on a distant planet, or which floats ominously into our solar system. What is the appeal of the giant alien object, and why does it inspire so many science fiction stories and novels? Is it a trope that has been over-used and worn out, or are new directions possible for this very specific sub-genre of science fiction?

title: Reading - Gina Goddard
description: Children's book reading in the family room

title: Spyro Co-op!
description: Play as Spyro and Cynder on their adventures to save the kingdom of dragons! Can you save the world?

title: WASFF Business Meeting
people: PRK , Doug Burbidge, Dave Cake, Cathy Cupitt, Anna Hepworth, Sarah Parker
description:
NOTICE OF 2015 WASFF ANNUAL GENERAL MEETING

At Swancon, in the Hamersley room of the Pan Pacific hotel in Perth on Sunday the 5th of April, 4pm.

Agenda:

0A.        Last call for nominations for the Board of WASFF
0B.        Last call for bids for the WARSFC (i.e. Swancon) for 2017

Meeting opens.

1. Apologies
2. Consideration of Minutes of the previous AGM
3. Matters arising from the previous AGM
4. Reports
    Chairman
    Treasurer
    Administrator
    Convention Steering Committee Co-ordinator
    Swancon 39 2014
    Swancon 40 2015
    Swancon 41 2016
5. Appointment of Auditor
6. Appointment of a Returning Officer
7. Election of Organising Committee of the Western Australian Science Fiction Convention (Swancon 42 2017)
8. Election of Members of the board of WASFF (3 elected positions)
9. Two Motions on Notice:

That the AGM direct the board undertake to review the structure and process of the CSC and report at the 2016 AGM.

That by-law 6.13 be amended to read:
6.13 Eligible voters for the Tin Duck Awards are members of the current WA Regional Science Fiction Convention including attending and supporting memberships, or are teen attendees as defined in regulation 9.3.2.

10. General Business


Bids for Swancon 2017 must received by the WASFF chair (Doug Burbidge) before the start of the meeting. Guidelines and a bid form are available:

http://wasff.sf.org.au/swanconbidding

http://wasff.sf.org.au/files/20140125%20Convention%20Bid%20Form.doc

Nominations for the 3 elected positions on the WASFF board must be received by the WASFF chair (Doug Burbidge) before the start of the meeting.

Minutes of last AGM: 
https://2015.swancon.com.au/system/attachments/production/ad8/962/8f2/971/5df/569/3/original/WASFF_AGM_Minutes_2014-04-20.pdf?1427038402

If you'd like to see the constitution, regulations and by-laws, they're at:

http://wasff.sf.org.au/constitution

Repeat of this notice: 
https://2015.swancon.com.au/content/wasff%20agm


--  Doug Burbidge   http://dougburbidge.com/   ph. 04 2293 7176

title: Is the Best of Comics Found in Non-Canon Works?
people: Travis Johnson, Werzel Montague, Sami Shah, Grant Watson, Sabian Wilde
description:
A critical and funny exploration of whether the best work in mainstream comics is actually to be found in non-canon works such as DC's Dark Night Returns and Injustice or Marvel's What If? series or one-shots like Old Man Logan?

Furthermore, has the culture of retcon and reboots destroyed the whole notion of canon works? What does the New (and newer) 52 and Ultimates mean for creating 'canon' works in the future? 

Join Perth's uber pop-culture tyrants Grant Watson (The Angriest, Fiction Machine) and Travis Johnson (X-Press Magazine, Celluloid and Whisky, FILM Ink) as they discuss the burning issues of the day with comedy geeks Werzel Montague (Pirate Church) and Sami Shah (author of I, Migrant and all-round clever-clogs).

title: The History of Studio Ghibli - Conclusion
description: Last year we discussed from 'Nausicaa: Valley of the Wind' all the way up to 'My Neighbors the Yamadas'. This year come to hear interest fact and tidbits about the well known 'Spirited Away' all the way up to the recent release 'When Marnie Was There' as well as the direction the studio is going now!

title: Guardian Princess Alliance - mini panel
description:
Ready for a Princess with a difference? An appreciation of the new series of books about multi-cultural Princesses who act together to save the planet. 

http://guardianprincesses.com/

title: Fundraising Auction - Setup
venues: South Ballroom (Traders and Art Show Room)
description: Fundraising Auction

title: The Science of Board Game Design
people: Steve Gunnell, Roland Kerr, Rob Masters, Anthony Sweet
description: Games aren't kid's stuff, even though kids and adults alike enjoy them. Serious number theory  and an understanding of social dynamics go into some of the most powerful games. Join some designers and enthusiasts as they take you for a journey into the nuts and bolts of game design - and discuss why it's needed, and whether there is an issue with the numbers taking over to the detriment of game play.

title: Kaffee Klatsch - Kylie Chan (2)
tags: Discussion, Guest of Honour Item, Writing
description:
In the Foyer to the right (near the Bar) 
Pre-purchased memberships can purchase tickets to this in advance. $5 per ticket. Maximum of 10 attendees.

title: Learn Take 6!
description: This card game will have you narrowly surveying your cards for the one that fits best. Fast, fun and sometimes frustrating, try to ensure that your opponents get to take cards, while you avoid taking cards yourself. If you're forced to, try to set up others to take a fall.

title: Star Wars -The Imperial Boarding Party
description:
Game: Star Wars -The Imperial Boarding Party,
System: Wizards of the Coast – Star Wars Saga Edition,
Genre: Space Opera,
Game Masters: Darcy Twentyman / Daniel Ryba,
Length: 3 hours,
Participants: 4-5 (excluding game masters),
 
A long time ago, in a galaxy far, far away...
 
It is a time of misguided opposition against the Glorious Empire. The galaxy is being torn apart by a war resulting from the ever increasing ambition of the so called Rebel Alliance. In a recent daring strike, the Rebels have slipped through the Imperial Security Forces and commandeered an Imperial Intelligence Corvette, Stalker. Their plan, steal the names of every imperial agent operating throughout the sector. During their rushed escape, Rebel General Lucian and his band of misfits, miscalculated the vessel’s hyperspace jump, sending the damaged corvette into an asteroid field. The Imperial Cruiser, Relentless, has been dispatched from a nearby system to recover the Stalker. Currently enroute, The Relentless and her loyal crew prepare for the upcoming operation... The PCs (stormtroopers/imperial officers/special agents) must board the corvette, fight their way through legions of misguided Rebel soldiers and their support droids and take control of the damaged vessel.

title: Fundraising Auction (And Art Show)
venues: South Ballroom (Traders and Art Show Room)

title: Kaffeeklatch - Donna Maree Hanson
description:
In the Foyer to the right (near the Bar) 
Pre-purchased memberships can purchase tickets to this in advance. $5 per ticket. Maximum of 10 attendees.

title: Then and Now: A comparison between 2015 and 1974 in the SFF scene.
tags: Fandom, Film, Guest of Honour Item, Literature, Mod, TV
people: Damian Magee, Anthony Peacey, Davina Watson
description:
MODERATOR: DAVINA WATSON
We have a look across fandom between the early days of the Perth Scene and now. What did we do then that we don't do any more? What do we do now that would seem impossible back then? What do we still do? Lets look at the year Swancon began! A look at the genre of the time, what books were released, what TV shows graced the screens and movies, music and more.

title: Short and Sweet: Games you can play in under 30 minutes
people: Warren Adams, Penny Carrier, Mark Johnson
description: Fun games you can play in under 30 minutes (followed by demo session in gaming room )

title: Trailer Park - Asian Cinema
description: Asian Cinema Trailer Park

title: Learn Ticket to Ride: Europe
description: This is a fast, incredibly popular and fun boardgame for the whole family. Easy to learn! Connect your cities and risk short cuts through tunnels to obtain your goals. Will your opponents block you? Play with your little carriage pieces in the meantime, and remember, every line you don't complete is subtracted from your score at the end!

title: Learn Survive! Escape from Atlantis!
description: The island seemed so peaceful but you and your tribe soon realise it's getting smaller. That can't be good. As lowland areas succumb to the waves you heave sighs of relief as you all head for the boats pointed at the mainland. But it looks like everyone else has the same idea, and there aren't enough boats. Oh well, you can swim. Try to avoid the sharks but perhaps the dolphins will help. And you're sure that the rumours of Giant Octopus and Sea Serpents are completely unfounded. Anyone still in the water or on on Atlantis when the volcano erupts isn't going to be contributing genes to the mainland settlements.

title: WABA Love Letter Tournament
description:
To court the princess, you must rely on others to take your romantic letters to her. Will yours reach her first?

Love Letter is a game of risk, deduction, and luck for 2–4 players. Deflect your rivals' love letters and get yours to the princess!

Only 16 places for this tournament, so sign up fast! First prize is a copy of "The Hobbit: Battle of the Five Armies" version of Love Letter!

title: Pairings in FanFic - the Good, the Bad, the Ugly
people: Belinda Forbes, Katherine McFarlane, Sarah McFarlane, Sandy Norman, Sarah Xu
description:
MODERATOR: SARAH XU 
In the world of fanfiction, there are some things that we just HATE and somethings we just love. What are your pet peeves? What are you pet pairings? Do Donna and Jack really live happily ever after?

title: Awards - Local
description: The Tin Duck Awards is the annual Western Australian Science Fiction Foundation (WASFF) Achievement Awards for WA writers and artists to recognise achievement in Western Australian Science Fiction (including fantasy and horror).

title: Griff Ball
description: The great sport of taking a land mine, running to the goal and then blowing your self up! Doesn't get much better than that! Play in teams of 4 against other teams of 4 and become the best team ever! Making up of funny team names is manditory and this game will be run as a tournament!

title: This game is so good, I'm prepared to speak for 3 minutes in public on it. (1)
people: Andrea Hatch, Brian Johnson, Ellora Ker, Rob Masters
description: Are you passionate about a game? You have 3 minutes to give a lightning presentation to persuade the audience that the game is worth trying! Watch as 9 other people speak passionately about games they think are worth it.

title: Learn Splendor
description:
Learn Splendor
Fast to play, deceptively simple to learn and a beautiful game, Splendor will have you mining the most wonderful gems - rubies, emeralds, sapphires, diamonds and others in the hopes of buying your own mines and shops, and even attracting a visit by a noble! If you find you enjoy it or like the sound of it, step up to the tournament.

title: Awards - National Awards
people: Kylie Chan, Samara Morgan, Anthony Peacey, John Scalzi, Grant Stone
description: SwanCon 40 is the 54th national convention and host of the national awards for recognising achievement for Australian writers and artists. The Ditmar award is to recognise achievement in Australian science fiction (including fantasy and horror), the E Bertram Chandler Award for Outstanding Achievement in Australian Science Fiction, the Norma K Hemming Award, marking excellence in the exploration of themes of race, gender, sexuality, class and disability in the form of science fiction and fantasy and the Peter McNamara Achievement Award which is the lifetime achievement award.

title: YouTube-a-Rama: The strangest fannish stuff we love from YouTube.
description: Come enjoy our YouTube Panel and see a song that cycles through 26 genres in 3 minutes, why chainmail bikinis make lousy armour, and ARMIES OF ADORABLE KITTENS.

title: Genderbending in Fanworks: Does my genderflip invalidate your slash and other questions?
people: Jack Bridges, Bec Handcock, Anna Hepworth, Katherine McFarlane, Sarah Xu
description:
MODERATOR: BEC HANDCOCK
A look at the way fanfiction gender bends canon texts. What do we get out of this, and why are people interested in reading, and doing this? What are people's favourite flips?

title: Live Action Role Play - "Diamond Geezers"
description:
"Diamond Geezers" is a LARP for 10 players, where you play London
gangsters after a big heist. (note -- some adult content and themes)
It takes about 2 hours to play, plus maybe 30 mins set up and
debriefing afterwards.

There is no physical contact (ie. no rubber swords) and very little
mechanics, but each player will have a somewhat detailed character sheet so if
we can get 10 players signed up by Saturday, then
I can hand out character sheets for people to read in advance. Some
props will be helpful, if allowed, such as toy guns.

title: Learn Ogre
description: This classic Steve Jackson two player game of ginormous cyber tank against an army. This is one of the most portable, affordable, cardboard wargames out there and it has held up well to the test of time.

title: Beyond IO9: Online sources of our fannish hits
people: Zara Baxter, Dave Cake, Lily Eivers, Brendan Ragan
description: Alternative sources of SF reviews and culture online, beyond the 900lb Gorilla in the corner

title: Convention Bag Stuffing - Volunteers Welcome!
venues: South Ballroom (Traders and Art Show Room)
description: Volunteers Welcome

title: MeepleAngel (gaming room helpers) Orientation
description: MeepleAngel (gaming room helpers) Orientation

title: Opening Ceremony 2015
people: Kylie Chan, Stephen Griffiths, John Parker, Sarah Parker, Anthony Peacey, John Scalzi
description: Opening ceremony, bells, whistles and stuff oh my!

title: Hanna-Barbera Part 2
description: (1970-79)-the Seventies for the company has lot more misses than hits and few classics that we can remember, why did some of series fail.  From Harlem Globetrotters, Josie and Pussycats to Valley of the Dinosaurs some of highlights

title: Meet the Swancon A/V guy
description: Attention Swancon panelist, this session has been allotted for you to come and check out the standard A/V setup of your panel room. Should you require to test your devices, now is the time! Your friendly A/V Guy, Andy Hahn, will be available to chat to if you have any questions or requests.

title: Open Console Gaming
description: Come play some consoles! Try new games, play with friends or catch up on a game you haven't finished yet.

title: Depiction of Religion in Science Fiction and Fantasy
tags: Fantasy, Guest of Honour Item, JP Review, Sci-Fi, Transformative Works
people: Kylie Chan, Jonathan Durnford, Dave Luckett
description:
A question and answer discussion panel with lots of audience participation. We will examine both Religion's influence on Science Fiction and Fantasy, but also the collective messages and opinions that writers have about religion in the realms of genre fiction.

Whether you're an Atheist, Jedi, a Red Priest of R'hllor, Unitologist or something even stranger, come down and and talk about questions such as: Why is there always a "Church of Witch Burning"? Are all Dark Lords reflections of the Devil? And where do DnD Clerics get their magic from?

title: Moderate Moderators: The HOWTO panel
description: Moderate Moderators - are you a moderator this year? If so come along to see your fellow moderators discuss ways and means to handle the speakers at Swancon. We aim for firm but fair, and sometimes we all need a little help in remaining calm, cool and collected. We look at tips to handle the most unruly, and ways to ensure your panel and speakers are a success!

title: The Warrior Awakens: Military Sci Fi - an Appreciation
people: PRK , Lex Burke, Christopher Courtis, John Scalzi, Frames White
description:
MODERATOR: PRK 
Why is Military Sci-Fi such a successful sub-genre? Why do so many of us like to read about the wars of the future? What tactics and mechanics need to change when our battles are pitched in space or on other planets? Panel may include references to Battlestar Galactica, Starship Troopers (the book), Richard Morgan, Neil Stevenson, Neil Asher and Charlie Stross novels, Orson Scott Card  and the Stargate franchise for mistakes mades and the Halo universe just for fun.

title: 9th Year of the Video Quiz: Swancon Birthday Edition
description: In its 9th year come join in the fun, with clips from Film, TV, and Music of the 1970’s

title: Land of the Setting Sun: The End of Anime?
description: Japan’s once-thriving animation industry is undergoing an unprecedented decline. Studios are closing, the number of anime films in cinemas is falling, audiences in general are moving onto other things, and reliable stalwarts of the medium such as Hayao Miyazaki and Isao Takahata have announced their retirement. What does the future hold for anime? Who are the new directors worth watching? What are the current trends in genre and visual aesthetics? What will anime – and anime fandom – look like in five years’ time? Is it possible that we are seeing the end, for all intents and purposes, of Japanese animation?

title: Learn Ugg-Tect
description: As palaeolithic builders you rely on teamwork, gestures and strange sounding words to get Stonehenge built the way it should be. Your Ugg-Tect knows what it should look like, but no one else does.  If you find you enjoy the game, step up for the panel game version of Ugg-Tect Royale (see program) as one of the contestants.

title: Home Brew in Space
description: So, brewing alcohol in space. How would the lack of gravity affect the process, and would the beer taste the same? Come along and listen to Stuart, a Chemist by day and home brewer by night, look into the mechanics of brewing alcohol in a zero grav environment.

title: Trailer Park - Adult Themes
description: For those who are new to Swancon, Trailer Park is a review of up coming trailers for next years movies and shows.

title: Voyager: a Celebration
description: A celebration of the 20th anniversary of the debut of Star Trek: Voyager. Including season reviews and favouite characters.

title: Under Construction - Finding and Keeping Committee
description: It takes a great committee to put on a great convention, but what does it take to assemble a great committee? Once you've assembled a great committee, how do you keep everyone on track and prevent committee members from burning out?

title: Learn Take 6!
description: This card game will have you narrowly surveying your cards for the one that fits best. Fast, fun and sometimes frustrating, try to ensure that your opponents get to take cards, while you avoid taking cards yourself. If you're forced to, try to set up others to take a fall.

title: Slides from the Early Years of Swancon
